wikipedia_page.main: Henry Gillard Glindoni R.B.A., A.R.W.S. (1850 – 20 November 1913) was a British painter noted for historical genre works.

response: * Dee is the subject of Henry Gillard Glindoni's painting John Dee performing an experiment before Queen Elizabeth I.

Glindon was married twice, first in 1820 to Mary Ann Adams who died in 1827, and then to Sarah Harris in 1829.  One of his grandchildren used the name Henry Gillard Glindoni, and became a respected and fashionable artist. Uche Amako, "Post Memories: Century since death of our fashionable artist", Barking and Dagenham Post, 27 September 2013. Retrieved 28 September 2020
